text: 33 cl. bottle. A hazy golden coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, grass, hops, fruit, citrus and with a bitter finish.

Grassy and citrus fruity aroma and taste, some lemon and satsuma sweetness, sweet malty, fruity and bitter hoppy finish. Decent.
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a huge white head. Aroma is fruity, floral. Light herbal hoppy. Slight greasy hoppy, fruity. Bitter and slight herbal. Bitter and dry hoppy finish.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of straw, hops, alcohol, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, hops, straw, alcohol, and straw, leading to a dry alcoholic finish.

Huge lasting offwhite/beige head. Clear still deep dark brownish red body. Resiny pineapple aroma with wooden notes. The pineapple feels acidic and unclean. Sweetish spicy orange peel taste with caramelly notes. Mid-to-full body. Mild, soft, light carbonation mouthfeel. Dryish-sweet spicy orange-peel aftertaste with smoky notes. Unusual and interesting. Well composed and highly drinkable. (0.33l can from El Corte Ingles, Placa Pius XII, Barcelona.)
UPDATED: DEC 6, 2016 Parece una maibock, malta y miel por encima del lúpulo. No se nota el alcohol pero si esteres bastante frutales, no parece muy lager pero sabe bien.

Golden color, white head with nice lacework. Aroma has notes of grassy hops with light yeasty and tropical fruits. Flavor is fruity, light to medium bitterness, hints of citrus. Light dry final with some bitterness.

Botella del @V Festival Milanito. 10/09/2016. BBD:01/02/16
Color amarillo, aromas resinosos, sabor herbal resinoso, final amargo.
Buenísima. Tiene un aromilla a miel muy buen. El primer sabor es fresco, cítrico y un tanto dulce. El sabor largo es muy bueno.

Bottle 33cl
@ Cervezas Arriaca, Yunquera de Henares, Spain.
A: Hazy golden.
T: Hops, fruity, slightly citrusy.

33cl bottle I brought back from Barcelona and the European Summer Gathering. Poured (twice) into an old Veltins Pilsner tulip at home during a random tasting evening with myself. Pours a misty, dull orange, on top an uneven, white head. Fruity hops lead the way in both the aroma and taste, with a good bitter bite in the flavour: no citrus notes! Big Bonus Point for that. This is a live tasting and I have only just realised it is 8.2% ABV, wondered why I was getting a buzz from it. Bugger, first beer of the evening.

From latiendadelacerveza. In Teku glass. At dinner, with biscotte + mackerel. Misses some hops-punch in taste and aroma for the style (maybe they didnt use very fresh hops?), but its very drinkable, with its ABV very well hidden. Bb date Feb 2018.

16/V/16 - sample as "Boris Brew Cappra" @ Leuven Innovation - BB: n/a (2016-592) Thanks to the Belgian RB crew for sharing todays beers!
Clear blond to orange beer, creamy off-white head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: lots of tropical fruits, grapefruit. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit. Aftertaste: bitter, hoppy, lots of citrus, some pineapple, bitter, nice!
Draft @ Barborteur Beerdays #1... Nice color, and aroma. Citrus, orange peal etc. very good DIPA from this two brewery.
It is a blonde beer, with flavour of IPA at the end. It is a little bitter in spite of be a blonde
Bottle at LIBF2, thanks for sharing! Hoppy, exotic, but also has regular pilsner taste, easily drinkable, nice enough.

Bottle @ LIBF16. Shared with the RB Belgian team.
Dorée, fin orange, col blanc.
Arôme est malté centré sur le pils avec un rétro fruité tropical des houblons qui apporte un bouquet intéressant sur une pils.
Palais est léger, malté, pointe citronné et agrumes pour un rappel pamplemousse. Un mélange qui tranche bien avec ce profil lager. La caractère malté pils - pâle est convenable et laisse ample place aux houblons tout en conservant cette approche plus pils impériale.
Clear bright yellow colour with thin head. Aroma of fresh green hop and citrus zest. Has a tangy freshness. Not overly bitter. Sessionable.
Yellow, nice head. Very hoppy clean. Soft, very low carbonation. Great bitterness. Yummy! The hops get out so well with this low and dry fermentation. (At Libf 2016)
